snippet: Nine public school students are challenging California’s tenure system, arguing that their right to a quality education is violated by job protections that make it too difficult to fire bad instructors.
abstract: Nine public school students are challenging California’s ironclad tenure system, arguing that their right to a good education is violated by job protections that make it too difficult to fire bad instructors; behind the students stand high-powered team of lawyers that includes Theodore B Olson, former solicitor general of the United States.
lead_paragraph: Nine public school students are challenging California’s tenure system, arguing that their right to a quality education is violated by job protections that make it too difficult to fire bad instructors.

headline.main: Fight Over Effective Teachers Shifts to Courtroom
headline.print_headline: Fight Over Effective Teachers Shifts to Courtroom
